name: Grovio Music Application
shortDescription: Grovio is a web application that simplifies the process of accessing music from various streaming services. By converting links from different platforms into YouTube music links, Grovio enables seamless music streaming and downloading. With its user-friendly interface, customizable options, and a modern in-app player, Grovio provides a streamlined and enjoyable music experience for users across desktop and mobile platforms.
description: Grovio is a web application developed using Svelte Kit, designed to streamline the process of accessing and enjoying music from various streaming services. It offers users a seamless experience by converting links from popular platforms such as Spotify, YouTube Music, Deezer, Apple Music, Tidal, Amazon Music, AudioMack, Qobuz, Napster, and more into YouTube music links. This conversion allows users to effortlessly stream and download their desired music using the YouTube InnerTube API. Grovio goes beyond simple conversion, providing additional functionalities like the downloading of track metadata and lyrics, customizable user interface options, and a modern in-app music player for an enhanced listening experience. The platform's responsive design ensures a consistent and user-friendly experience across desktop and mobile devices.

name: Simon FPGA Game
shortDescription: The Simon Game is a classic memory game that challenges players to replicate increasingly complex sequences of lights. The Simon Game FPGA project for Basys3 faithfully recreates this experience, integrating smooth transitions, reliable button input, and informative 7-segment display feedback, all within a collaborative open-source development environment.
description: The Simon Game FPGA project, tailored for the Basys3 FPGA development board, is a faithful recreation of the classic memory and cognitive skill-testing game. Designed to engage players in a captivating experience, the game involves generating random sequences of lights and sounds displayed on LEDs, which players must memorize and replicate using the corresponding buttons. With a sophisticated state machine ensuring smooth gameplay transitions, the project showcases seamless integration of button debouncing for reliable player input. The 7-segment displays serve to convey the player's score and highest step reached, fostering an immersive and competitive gaming atmosphere. Created by a dedicated team of developers, including Oruç Çakır, Osman Cesur, and Ömer İlbilgi, this open-source project encourages contributions, adhering to best practices for code quality and readability. The project is distributed under the MIT License, granting users the freedom to modify, distribute, and utilize the code, provided the original license file accompanies any redistributed versions.

name: Snake Ai Game
shortDescription: Snake-AI is a 2D game developed using Svelte Kit, delivering an immersive classic snake gameplay experience. The upcoming version will introduce an AI feature, enhanced graphics, and sound effects, alongside plans for leaderboard integration.
description: Snake-AI is a 2D game developed using the Svelte Kit framework, offering a nostalgic and engaging gameplay experience centered around the classic Snake concept. Its user-friendly design ensures a seamless transition between desktop and mobile devices, fostering an immersive gaming experience. Notably, the game leverages a well-optimized doubly linked list algorithm, enabling efficient management of the snake's movements and body, thereby guaranteeing a consistently smooth and responsive gameplay, even as the snake dynamically elongates. While the current version of the game focuses on manual user control, the upcoming version is poised to introduce an advanced AI feature for autonomous gameplay, along with a significant overhaul in graphics and audio effects. Furthermore, the roadmap for future iterations entails plans for integrating a leaderboard and achievements system, as well as incorporating multiplayer support and additional game modes and levels. With its commitment to seamless performance and a user-centric approach, Snake-AI invites contributions from developers interested in enriching the game's functionality and features, thereby fostering a vibrant and collaborative community around this exciting project.

name: Maze Visualizer
shortDescription: The Maze Visualizer is a user-friendly web tool built with Svelte Kit, enabling the generation and solving of mazes using various algorithms. It offers an interactive interface for users to visualize the maze creation and solution process, catering to both desktop and mobile platforms. With support for a diverse range of algorithms, it provides a seamless and engaging experience for maze enthusiasts and learners alike.
description: The Maze Visualizer is a  web-based tool that leverages the power of Svelte Kit to deliver an immersive and educational experience in maze generation and solving. This sophisticated application offers users an opportunity to explore the intricacies of various maze generation algorithms, including the Recursive Backtracker, Prim's Algorithm, Kruskal's Algorithm, Eller's Algorithm, Wilson's Algorithm, Hunt and Kill Algorithm, Binary Tree Algorithm, Sidewinder Algorithm, Aldous-Broder Algorithm, and Growing Tree Algorithm. Additionally, it provides a comprehensive set of maze solving algorithms, such as Depth-First Search (DFS), Breadth-First Search (BFS), A* Search, Dijkstra's Algorithm, Wall Follower (Left Hand Rule, Right Hand Rule), Trémaux's Algorithm, Dead-end filling Algorithm, Pledge Algorithm, Flood Fill Algorithm, and Bellman-Ford Algorithm. The application's intuitive interface allows users to visualize the maze generation and solving processes in real time, fostering a deeper understanding of the underlying concepts. With a focus on seamless user interaction, the Maze Visualizer ensures optimal performance and responsiveness on both desktop and mobile platforms, catering to a diverse range of users, from maze enthusiasts to educational institutions and beyond.

name: Speed Micro Mouse
shortDescription: The Speed Micro Mouse is a robot designed to navigate a maze autonomously. With its sophisticated design and advanced features, including a 3D-printed chassis, a custom PCB, and a powerful STM32 microcontroller, the Speed Micro Mouse offers a seamless and engaging experience for enthusiasts and learners alike.
description: The Speed Micro Mouse is a robot designed to navigate a maze autonomously. With its sophisticated design and advanced features, including a 3D-printed chassis, a custom PCB, and a powerful STM32 microcontroller, the Speed Micro Mouse offers a seamless and engaging experience for enthusiasts and learners alike. The project's hardware design is centered around the STM32F407VG microcontroller, which serves as the brain of the robot, controlling the motors and sensors. The robot's chassis is 3D-printed, with a custom PCB serving as the base. The PCB is designed to accommodate the microcontroller, motor drivers, and sensors, along with the battery and charging circuitry. The robot's sensors include an MPU6050 accelerometer and gyroscope, a VL53L0X time-of-flight (ToF) distance sensor, and a QTR-8RC line sensor array. The Speed Micro Mouse is a collaborative project, developed by a team of dedicated students, including Oruç Çakır, Osman Cesur, and Ömer İlbilgi, with the goal of participating in the IEEE Turkey Micro Mouse Competition.
